title: Auto-commit dirty tick files before worktree run
description:
When starting a worktree run, if only .tick/issues/*.json files are dirty, auto-commit them instead of failing.

**Problem:**
Ticker modifies tick files during runs (status updates, notes). When user wants to run ticker again, it fails:
```
Error: Cannot start parallel run - main branch has uncommitted changes
Dirty files:
  .tick/issues/32y.json
  ...
```

**Solution:**
Before starting worktree run:
```go
if onlyTickFilesDirty() {
    git add .tick/issues/*.json
    git commit -m "chore: Auto-commit tick status updates"
    // Continue with worktree run
}
```

**Why safe:**
- Tick files are system-managed metadata, not user code
- Machine-managed, not hand-edited
- Committing preserves history (non-destructive)
- User almost always wants them committed

**Edge case:**
If other dirty files exist, require human intervention (current behavior).

Acceptance criteria:
- [ ] Detect when only .tick/ files are dirty
- [ ] Auto-commit with standard message
- [ ] Continue with worktree setup
- [ ] If mixed dirty files, fail as before
